com.nttdocomo.ui
Class UIException

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--java.lang.Throwable
        |
        +--java.lang.Exception
              |
              +--java.lang.RuntimeException
                    |
                    +--com.nttdocomo.ui.UIException
public class UIException
extends java.lang.RuntimeException

This defines the UIExceptions. It is generated to indicate that components and the like of the UI package caused exceptions during execution. Details on exceptions can be obtained with the getStatus method.

          Indicates that the resources are busy (=3).

Field Detail

UNDEFINED

public static final int UNDEFINED
This indicates that the status is undefined (=0). When an exception does not need a status to be set, this value is set for the status.

See Also:

Constant Field Values

STATUS_FIRST

protected static final int STATUS_FIRST
The first status code value to be used in this exception (=0). Including the reserved values, this is the first status code value to be used in this exception.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

STATUS_LAST

protected static final int STATUS_LAST
The last status code value to be used in this exception (=63). Including the reserved values, this is the last status code value to be used in this exception.

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Constructor Detail

UIException

public UIException()
This creates a UIException object without a detailed message. The status is set as UNDEFINED.

UIException

public UIException(int status)
This creates a UIException object without a detailed message.

Parameters:
status - Designates the status value to be set.

UIException

public UIException(int status,
                   java.lang.String msg)
This creates a UIException object with a detailed message.

msg - Designates the detailed message.
